rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120533

self.title: CDISC SEND SEND Cardiovascular Test Name Terminology

definition: Terminology related to the SEND cardiovascular test name codelist.
name: SEND Cardiovascular Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND SEND Cardiovascular Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of a subject's physical activity or movement.
The blood pressure after the contraction of the heart while the chambers of the heart refill with blood. (NCI)
The number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute. (NCI)
The pressure within the left ventricle of the heart at the end of the period when the chambers of the heart refill with blood and just before the contraction begins.
The maximum rate of negative pressure change over time within the left ventricle (diastole).
The maximum rate of positive pressure change over time within the left ventricle (systole).
The minimum rate of positive pressure change over time within the left ventricle (systole).
The pressure within the left ventricle of the heart during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart.

The mean pressure of the blood within the arterial circulation. The arterial pressure may be directly measured by insertion of an intra-arterial catheter connected to a transducer. The mean arterial pressure (MAP) can be calculated by subsequent analysis of the waveform. MAP can be approximated without an invasive procedure using the following formula: diastolic pressure plus 1/3 of the pulse pressure, where pulse pressure is systolic pressure - diastolic pressure. (NCI)
The positive pressure that correlates with the maximum dP/dt, the rate of change in pressure over time.
The positive pressure that correlates with the minimum dP/dt, the rate of change in pressure over time.
The change in systolic to diastolic pressure which produces a pulse.
The maximum time interval between the Q wave on an ECG and the onset of the aortic blood pressure pulse.
The mean time interval between the Q wave on an ECG and the onset of the aortic blood pressure pulse.
The median time interval between the Q wave on an ECG and the onset of the aortic blood pressure pulse.
The minimum time interval between the Q wave on an ECG and the onset of the aortic blood pressure pulse.
The blood pressure during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart. (NCI)
The resistance to blood flow through the systemic vasculature.
The average rate of pressure change over time within the left ventricle (systole).
